page.title: 05BUILDINGS
page.content: There are not many new buildings in this area, except in part of the village of Walton on Trent,where there is an estate of council houses built about thirty years ago,and some private housing built during the last twenty years.Most of the houses are privately owned.The farm houses were built between 150 to 200 years ago. Many of the cottages are even older,some are at least 400 years old.These older buildings are timber framed. The main building material is red brick. These were made locally from the clays around Burton on Trent. There are two large houses,{Walton {Hall}and {Catton Hall}. Both houses date from the mid-eighteenth century,but are built on the site of previous manor houses. They are not open to the public,but
